result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant appeared with counsel SPD Carly Sebion, appearing specially for Paul Fredrickson.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Will be set for FPT and a 1-day jury trial.  (Sent copy of minutes to J.O.)

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to use any hazardous substances.  Obey all rules of his current supervision.

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Fredrickson appeared in person.  Reading of complaint waived. Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by court.  Court advised the defendant the charge and possible penalties.
